frame.name: Fall_for
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Victim</fen> comes to have incorrect beliefs as a result of exposure to a <fen>Deception</fen>. The <fen>Deception</fen> is necessarily orchestrated by one or more agents, though these are not expressible by the LUs in this frame.
<ex><fex name="vic">The public</fex> was too clever to <t>fall for</t> <fex name="dec">the type of propaganda prevalent in London at the time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> has false beliefs as a result of exposure to a <fex name="dec">Deception</fex>.
<ex><fex name="vic">Seventeen respected scientists</fex> <t>fell for</t> the lie before it was revealed as a hoax.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Deception
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Deception</fen> is perceived by the <fen>Victim</fen>, leading to false beliefs. The <fen>Deception</fen>, orchestrated by an agent or agents with the intention of deception, may be any misinformation, event, or situation perceived by the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Even the smartest person can fall for <fex name="dec">a cleverly-designed scam</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Victim</fen> falls for the <fen>Deception</fen>.
<ex>They <t>fell for</t> it <fex name="tim">immediately</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Victim</fen> falls for the <fen>Deception</fen>.
<ex>Young children were found to accept ridiculous ideas in the classroom which they would <t>fall for</t> <fex name="pla">at home</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the way <fen>Victim</fen> is deceived which is not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>I can't believe she <fex name="man">so gullibly</fex> <t>fell for</t> his lies and flattery.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Degree to which the <fen>Victim</fen> believes the <fen>Deception</fen>.
<ex>He <t>fell for</t> it <fex name="deg">completely</fex>.</ex> <ex>Thankfully I only <fex name="deg">partially</fex> <t>fell for</t> the scam.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fall for.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be deceived; come to have false beliefs or come to an incorrect conclusion as a result of deception.
